texto1: Cambiar de dirección/ dirección completamente
texto4: He had to turn around and go back home

texto1: Alterar el curso o dirección de algo
texto4: The company managed to turn around its financial situation.

texto1: No aceptar una oferta o propuesta.
texto4: She turned down the job offer.

texto1: No aceptar una invitación.
texto4: He turned down the invitation to the party.

texto1: Hacerse presente o visible.
texto4: She turned up late to the meeting.

texto1: Aumentar el volumen o la intensidad de algo
texto4: Can you turn up the volume?

texto1: Introducir un tema en una conversación.
texto4: She brought up the issue during the meeting

texto1: Educar y cuidar a un niño.
texto4: They brought up their children in a loving environment.

texto1: Regresar algo al lugar de donde vino.
texto4: Please bring back the book you borrowed.

texto1: Hacer que alguien recuerde algo.
texto4: This song brings back many memories.

texto1: Llevar algo a un lugar.
texto4: Can you bring in the groceries from the car?

texto1: Generar o aportar ingresos (get in)
texto4: The new product line is expected to bring in significant revenue.

texto1: Seguir haciendo algo.
texto4: Please go on with your story.

texto1: Suceder o tener lugar.
texto4: What’s going on here?

texto1: Seguir adelante después de una pausa.
texto4: After a brief break, they went on with the meeting.

texto1: Ir fuera de casa, especialmente para socializar.
texto4: They decided to go out for dinner.

texto1: Dejar de arder o funcionar (usualmente una luz o fuego).
texto4: The fire went out during the night.

texto1: Estar en una relación romántica con alguien.
texto4: They have been going out for three months.

texto1: Volver al lugar de origen.
texto4: We need to go back to the office.

texto1: Retornar a una condición o estado previo.
texto4: He went back to his old habits.

texto1: believe
texto4: believe
